image.altText: Kylie dancing with a graphic saying 'how much money my online business made in a week'.

props.synopsis: Women in regional Australia are being funnelled into a multi-level marketing scheme promising a "multiple six figure business online" – but the "freedom" they seek comes at cost.

title.children: Thousands of women are being funnelled into an MLM promising 'financial freedom', but what's the real cost?

image.altText: HMAS Stalwart berths at the newly built Kuru wharf at HMAS Coonawarra in Darwin, NT.

props.synopsis: Australia's newest warship is undergoing emergency mechanical repairs to address "engine defects", at the same time the navy's only other supply class vessel remains out of service.

title.children: Australia's newest warship breaks down, undergoing emergency mechanical repairs after just 3 years of service

image.altText: A black and white portrait shows a group of students sitting on top of a clocktower, one shouts into megaphone

props.synopsis: Democracy is built on the right of citizens to voice dissent. A glance at the history of our political leaders' involvement with student protests perhaps goes some way to explaining the response to the pro-Palestine movement on campuses today.

title.children: Student political stunts of years gone by don't tell us everything — but in Albanese's case, it taught him a lesson

image.altText: A person sits in a car without touching the wheel

props.synopsis: Self-driving cars are better at routine tasks but are five times more likely to be involved in an accident in low-light.

title.children: Self-driving cars 'generally' safer, but more at risk of accidents at dusk and dawn

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair and glasses speaks in front of a media wall that says "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: Pressure is growing on the Reserve Bank to lift interest rates again as inflation remains stubbornly high, but governor Michele Bullock knows another rate hike all but guarantees a recession.

title.children: The RBA is still on a 'narrow path' to avoid the recession it thinks we don't have to have

image.altText: Justin Timberlake

props.synopsis: Boy band singer-turned-solo star and actor Justin Timberlake has been arrested and charged with a drink-driving offence, according to New York law enforcement officials.

title.children: Singer Justin Timberlake arrested and charged with driving while intoxicated

image.altText: A young white woman reaches out and touches the shoulder of a young Chinese man amid a crowd of reporters.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has weighed in in defence of Australian journalist Cheng Lei after she was obstructed by Chinese embassy officials.

title.children: 'Clumsy' Cheng Lei incident prompts complaint from Anthony Albanese to China's premier

image.altText: Amal Ein Alshaiba poses for a photo standing outdoors.

props.synopsis: A survey of immigrant community leaders suggests their members are being hit harder than the wider community by the cost-of-living crisis, but also that they are showing resilience and helping each other.

title.children: As costs have risen, Amal found a solution in her kitchen

image.altText: Anthony Albanese seen at a green sporting oval

props.synopsis: The bill could inflame tensions between Labor and some of the union’s top brass, such as Victorian state secretary John Setka.

title.children: Federal government to introduce CFMEU busting legislation to parliament

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank has kept rates on hold at its June meeting, leaving the cash rate at 4.35 per cent, as RBA governor says she's not expecting a recession.

title.children: RBA keeps interest rate at 4.35 per cent, says rate rise could be on cards as governor says she's not expecting a recession in Australia

image.altText: A woman in a blue dress speaks at a press conference outside a court building

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Scott Morrison may be among those called to give evidence at the defamation trial Senator Linda Reynolds has brought against former Liberal staffer Brittany Higgins, a Perth court is told.

title.children: Scott Morrison revealed as witness in Linda Reynolds' defamation case against Brittany Higgins

image.altText: Picture of large western rock lobster

props.synopsis: Trade Minister Don Farrell says Australian rock lobster will soon be back on Chinese plates but claims the ban has always been a "biosecurity issue".

title.children: 'Biosecurity issue': Trade Minister Don Farrell on China's ongoing lobster ban

image.altText: Joe Biden in the Oval office.

props.synopsis: New plans announced by the White House could pave the way for half a million immigrants to obtain permanent residency in the US.

title.children: 500,000 undocumented spouses could get US citizenship under new Biden administration plan

image.altText: Peter Dutton during QT

props.synopsis: A snap meeting of Coalition MPs has been called, sparking speculation the opposition could soon reveal its long-awaited nuclear policy.

title.children: Snap Coalition meeting sparks speculation nuclear policy imminent

image.altText: A composite image of Robert Irwin on the left sitting on a chair and smiling and Pauline Hanson in a red blouse grimacing

props.synopsis: Pauline Hanson's One Nation party ignored Robert Irwin's demand the video be removed by 5pm on Monday, with the son of Steve Irwin portrayed alongside Bluey in unapproved political messaging ahead of October's state election.

title.children: Robert Irwin stays silent on his Pauline Hanson defamation threat as deadline passes

image.altText: Two women in white puffy wedding dresses holding hands, smiling and marching in a pride festival with rainbow flag

props.synopsis: Thailand's Senate approves a landmark bill allowing couples such as Anticha and Worawan to finally get married.

title.children: Thailand becomes first South-East Asian country to legalise same sex marriage

image.altText: A blurry photo of a plane with a flame coming from it.

props.synopsis: A passenger on a Melbourne-bound flight which had to make an emergency landing in New Zealand after an engine caught fire has praised the pilots for managing a safe descent and ensuring no-one was injured.

title.children: Passenger praises pilots after Virgin flight to Melbourne makes emergency landing due to engine fire

image.altText: A shadow covers the left half of the screen while a man in glasses and a suit looks away from the camera on the other side.

props.synopsis: Housing for essential workers and billions in funding for new and upgraded schools are just some of the big-ticket items in NSW Treasurer Daniel Mookhey's second budget.

title.children: Who are the winners and losers in this year's NSW budget?

image.altText: A man speaks at a lectern

props.synopsis: NSW Liberal MP Matt Kean says he has no intention to run for federal parliament after announcing his resignation from politics.

title.children: Former state treasurer quits politics while hitting out at 'worst NSW budget in modern history'

image.altText: Co-living by Gallery Group house from their web page.

props.synopsis: With growing demand for share houses, some say co-living could be the alternative — but others say it's just a marketing ploy.

title.children: 'A race to the bottom': People are turning to co-living to beat the rental market, but some say it's a slippery slope

image.altText: Troy Bell walks outside a court building holding a note pad.

props.synopsis: Troy Stephen Bell stands trial accused of using his position of power to "syphon" money meant for a program to keep "at-risk" youth who had disengaged from mainstream education in training programs.

title.children: 'Charismatic and persuasive' South Australian MP allegedly stole funds to pay for home renovations

image.altText: A man speaking into a microphone at an inquiry.

props.synopsis: An army pilot has described a "daunting" near miss in a Taipan helicopter, three years before four men died in the same aircraft off the Queensland coast.

title.children: Pilot's near miss in Taipan helicopter prior to 'catastrophic' fatal crash that killed four

image.altText: Soldiers march towards other troops in a line.

props.synopsis: South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff says it doesn't believe the North Koreans intruded the border intentionally and that the North did not return fire.

title.children: South Korea fires shots after North Korean troops cross border

image.altText: Three men wearing black sitting side by side on a table. A blue and white Israeli flag is in the background.

props.synopsis: The Israeli prime minister had disbanded the war cabinet overseeing military decisions in Gaza after the resignation of one of its three members. The move will likely consolidate Benjamin Netanyahu's influence over the conflict.

title.children: Israel's PM has dissolved his war cabinet. What does that mean?

image.altText: A sick-looking woman with long brown hair wipes her nose with a tissue while sitting in front of a laptop, talking on a phone.

props.synopsis: You can now use an online statutory declaration as evidence for personal leave from work, without a JP signature.

title.children: The free document you can download online and use for sick leave

image.altText: Small people figurines stand in front of an Adobe logo design

props.synopsis: The US government is suing Adobe, accusing the design software giant of "trapping" customers into year-long subscriptions through concealing hefty termination fees and making it difficult for members to cancel.

title.children: Software giant Adobe accused of 'trapping' customers into subscriptions, making it difficult to cancel

image.altText: A man in a suit named Li Qiang waves before boarding a plane.

props.synopsis: Pandas might have dominated the headlines when the Chinese Premier visited South Australia, but the only other state Li Qiang is visiting has bigger ambitions — and its all about mining.

title.children: Forget wine and pandas, it’s all about rocks and minerals as China premier heads west

image.altText: A woman with frustrated expression seen looking into laptop screen with blurred kitchen behind her.

props.synopsis: Fake job listings are increasingly used by companies to give the illusion they're thriving and to placate overworked staff. If you're applying for work, there are plenty of clues to look out for to avoid wasting your time.

title.children: Ever heard of a 'ghost job'? You might have already wasted your time applying for one

image.altText: A four-wheel-drive on Teewah Beach

props.synopsis: Indigenous elders say a landmark native title claim in heavily urbanised and tourist destinations of south-east Queensland will not change the way people enjoy or live in the area.

title.children: 'Life will still go on' after successful Kabi Kabi native claim in south-east Queensland

image.altText: Caged hen at Werribee in Victoria

props.synopsis: Poultry farmers continue to fight Australia's largest outbreak of avian influenza as the disease is detected at a seventh Victorian farm.

title.children: More than one million birds to be killed in Victoria to stop the spread of deadly disease

image.altText: A young Aboriginal woman with traditional facial decorations looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Witnessing family violence as a child can lead to a range of issues in adulthood yet support services for this vulnerable group are few and far between.

title.children: Why domestic violence advocates and victim-survivors say the system fails young people

image.altText: Connor Garden-Bachop playing for the Highlanders in 2024.

props.synopsis: The New Zealand rugby union community comes together to pay respect to Māori All Blacks representative Connor Garden-Bachop, who died on Monday aged 25.

title.children: New Zealand rugby in mourning after Māori All Black dies following 'medical event'

image.altText: Jayson Tatum celebrates a basket in the NBA Finals

props.synopsis: The Boston Celtics seal their status as one of the great single-season teams, as the franchise is rewarded for keeping its faith in an oft-criticised star duo. Here are five quick hits from the 2024 NBA Finals.

title.children: Five quick hits — Celtics cap off all-time season with team-building patience vindicated as Mavs star experiences heartache

image.altText: White frost covers the grass in Canberra as cows graze

props.synopsis: Eastern Australia will continue to shiver through unusually cold temperatures for the rest of the week, with some capitals facing their coldest morning of the year so far, days out from the winter solstice.

title.children: Large parts of Australia stuck in cold snap as shortest day of year nears
